question: Who among the following Governor-Generals of India introduced the first Railway line in India?
explanation: Reforms of Lord Dalhousie (1848-56): In 1853 AD, he introduced the first Railway line in India from Bombay to Thane, the first telegraph line from Calcutta to Agra and established the postal system on the modern lines through the length and breadth of the country, which made communication easier.
